answers.text:
Hello David,
As it happens, the MPI was the winner of the 2012 ICMA Program Excellence Awards for Community Partnership:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304199/Municipal_Partnering_Initiative__Glenview_IL_Lake_Forest_IL
While it is quite a unique program in terms of size, local governments have been fairly resourceful when it comes to partnering for mutual benefit.  You can check the Partnerships topic for a collection of information on the subject:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/194/Partnerships
I also found a couple of examples by searching the Documents section:
Covington and Maple Valley partnered to find ways of reducing costs through bulk purchasing:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304204/CovingtonMaple_Valley_Partnership_Program
This is an agreement between the City of Casa Grande and a local high school.  The costs are shared evenly:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301575/The_Casa_Grande_Joint_Use_Library
Two municipalities found a way to split water distribution costs by building a joint water tank.  It's some pretty cool technology:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304203/Dual_Core_Storage_Tanks
Hope these help!
Gabe Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: David Rauch
text:
Hello. My name is David Rauch, a graduate student at Northern Illinois University. I am interested in finding examples of jointly-contracted maintenance services initiated at the local level. The Village of Glenview, IL has a program called the Municipal Partnering Initiative (MPI) in which 18 communities pool their resources and together contract road resurfacing, crack sealing, sewer lining, and more.
Does anyone have similar examples of programs like the MPI? I am interested in writing a masters dissertation on the relative cost-savings of municipalities participating in this kind of venture, and I'd like a comparison program.
My email is drauch@downers.us and I look forward to hearing from you.
David R
title: Jointly-Contracted Maintenance services - Research
